author: cryptotexty
title: Cardano Hub - Eastern Europe
description: There are many developers and big economic potential in Eastern Europe, but still, Cardano is not so known to the broader audience

f6_assessments.q0: The author of the proposal states that in Eastern Europe there is a huge economic potential that is not being tapped by the Cardano ecosystem because it is not known by a wider audience, he proposes to address this problem by having a physical location in the center of Kyiv. I generally agree that this proposal is aligned with what the challenge seeks as it will directly create a new hub. However, because no specific metrics are presented and the "incentives" described are very generic it is very difficult to accurately assess the impact.
f6_assessments.q1: While it is unfortunate that the author did not meet the minimum requirements of feasibility, from his description it is clear that the author is aligned with the values of Cardano, as it seems to me that it is a great idea to generate a hub in Kyiv. However, there are several areas that need to be addressed, including: (1) The following three "managers" are mentioned; a description of their profiles and links to their resumes would be beneficial. The roles that these individuals will play should also be described. As a physical location will be rented, it is necessary to describe whether or not you already have an agreement with this location. Do you need licenses? Permits that need to be considered? It is also unclear from what date the site will open. (3) this challenge seeks among other objectives to add new users to the ecosystem, I recommend that the author focus on how this will be achieved.
f6_assessments.q2: Unfortunately, the proposer also does not mention the minimum requirements for evaluating auditability, although it mentions a time frame within which it will be economically sustainable after 6 months, but more details are definitely required. Is there a potential Go-Live event? What will be the details of the different events that will be held? Will there be a reporting structure for the community members? Also, it is necessary that the author include success metrics that the community can audit at any time during the implementation process.

f6_assessments.q0:
"Building a physical place, located in the center of Kyiv for Cardano Hub is quite interesting and can help people connect with each other directly to build projects for Cardano.

But if the proposal is only for a physical place, it could be geographically difficult for a lot of people. In my opinion, the proposal that can combine both online and offline for its programs will make a greater impact on the community in Eastern Europe

Besides, the proposer has not specified specific jobs that can help this hub develop, but just created a coffee shop for people to meet and discuss Cardano. So what if they just came over for coffee and didn't say anything about Cardano?"
f6_assessments.q1:
"Proposer has many years of experience in the blockchain field and has also submitted the ""Community Hub"" idea in Project Catalyst Fund1 and Fund6 which is also a significant experience but in my opinion that is not enough to prove the proposer has ability to accomplish the objective of this proposal.

In addition, I have yet to see the specific work this proposal will take to achieve the goal. Proposer also failed to give any goals or KPIs for the proposal. This makes it impossible for me to envision what success does this proposal look like.

In addition, the proposal spend too much money to rent a physical place and pay money managers without allocating money for the main activities of a hub is unreasonable."
f6_assessments.q2:
"This proposal does not clearly state the results the team wants to achieve and the specific work to make the proposal successful. As a result, tracking the results of the proposal is nearly impossible.

Besides, the proposal is just trying to create a physical place for people to meet and discuss Cardano issues. I wonder how can they know if people are discussing about Cardano in that place or not"

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great idea for the Cardano community to expand to Eastern Europe. Getting more new users acquainted with Cardano is a great thing to expand the Cardano community which gives value to the Cardano community itself. This proposal makes it clear to us what the problem is and offers us a solution. Unfortunately there are no KPIs so it's hard to compare KPIs with challenge setting. It would be good to show people who have ideas like this how they can be even better at drafting proposals.
f6_assessments.q1: It would be good to have proof of experience and skill via LinkedIn or Github, maybe to start with Telegram group or Discord acc. In this proposal we have no information about the team and who is behind this great idea, too bad. The proposal states, in my opinion, an excessive amount of money that covers the costs of renting space and the salary of the manager. There is a detailed implementable plan which is great but the whole idea does not meet the funding criteria. In the proposal there is no realistic timetable to complete the work although the idea is really great. All the plan describes are resources necessary to implement the proposal but it is not clear on what principle the whole idea will be realized. Risks and technical aspects are not mentioned, which proves once again that we lack understanding and knowledge of how to prepare a proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: This idea is really phenomenal and it is more about the so-called of the real material world. It would be good to have a roadmap with milestones and KPIs. There are ways to get funding for this proposal but it needs to be well prepared. This idea unfortunately cannot be followed by the community due to lack of information.

solution: Cardano Hub in Eastern Europe (in Kyiv, Ukraine)
experience: 5 years in blockchain, in Project Catalyst since Fund1, currently building Cardano development company, in 2019 run crypto bar in Kyiv
